Reviews.Content: Very Nice and confortable ,good location I choose it because of location and price of single room for 2nights.It was nice location by walking around even at night time. Safe and clean.One of disappointment is that the reception was not ground floor, therefore we have to go up stairs to enter it . If you have heavy baggage, should ask to help.THere is on the street of high branded store, if you want to do window shopping , you can enjoy a lot.One of another thing to mention, there is only shower room for single room. However amenity goods are enough.
Reviews.Author: naolondon

Reviews.Content: Great stay at Albergotto! I had a great stay in this small charming hotel in the heart of Florence, right in via Tornabuoni where all the boutiques are situated. Around the corner from all the museums, churches, the Pontevecchio, it was just perfect! I've been in other hotels in Florence but this is by far the one I enjoyed most. The location is perfect, the staff is friendly and helpful, the rooms are pretty, the beds confortable, there's a living room where you can have a drink and relax at the day's end, rather than a hotel it feels like staying in a private club. It's a just great place to use as home base to discover Florence!
Reviews.Author: NatalieNyc

Reviews.Content: A dream in Fllorence My partner and I stayed at the Albergotto for a week. From the moment we arrived, the service was excellent. A helpful and very nice receptionist greeted us the first day and made sure we had everything we needed. The following days were a dream and the location is perfect, close to the main sights and in a very quiet area. Our room was superb and beautifully furnished with a great size bathroom. Breakfasts were excellent; with a large variety of foods and beverages. Most importantly for us was the waiting staff, all of whom were very professional and kind. They truly made us feel at home!!! Looking forward to returning in the very near future!!! OL from Madrid
Reviews.Author: Spainey

Reviews.Content: very nice The Albergotto was a three-star hotel with all the modern conveniences. My superior room was very nice, moderately spacious, with a huge window and quality appointments. The bathroom was very large, with another huge window out of which I enjoyed viewing the street life below. There was a mini-fridge and kettle and safe. The dining room was pleasant and the breakfast selection was good: breads, pastries, hardboiled eggs, meats, cheeses, fresh fruits, yogurt. The location is excellent, on a busy street, near the Arno, in the center of everything. The ladies at the desk, Simone, Monica and Valentina, were wonderful, very helpful and knowledgeable. They recommended a day tour into Tuscany with a driver and a van, which was great - there were 5 of us tourists, and he took us to a winery, to San Gimingnano, to another small medieval town, and to Siena. The whole day was only 89 Euros.
Reviews.Author: msjude

Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, great location Very nice small hotel and a great location. Easily walkable to/from the train station and all the major tourist sites. Bordered by busy streets, but our room was quiet. Our room was not decorated quite as spiffy as the ones pictured, but it was nice  clean nonetheless. No issues with A/C or comfort. Excellent continental breakfast each morning. Front desk and wait staff were always friendly and helpful.HEADS-UP - If stairs are an issue, be aware the front desk and elevator are one floor up from street level. We found this at our Venice hotel also.Had a nice dinner 2 blocks away at a hotel-recommended restaurant, Tratorria al Trebbio, located on Via delle Belle Donne.
Reviews.Author: tradi_travel

Reviews.Content: great experience My sister and I stayed at this hotel for a long weekend. The hotel is wonderfully located; close to the major sights but away from the busiest thoroughfares.Our room was reasonably large with a good sized shower room. We had no problems with noise. Breakfast was excellent; plentiful, varied and fresh. The dining-room is small but well appointed and the service excellent.The only drawback to this hotel is the flight of stairs that must be climbed before one reaches the lift. Apart from that I would recommend the Albergotto without hesitation.
Reviews.Author: Guadalix

Reviews.Content: Great Location       Partial view from our room
Reviews.Author: Arden92

Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel A beautiful hotel in a fantastic location surrounded by great shops. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Staff will carry your bags up the stairs (lift doesnt start until the 1st floor). Parking can be arranged in a garage by the hotel. I would definately recommend this hotel.
Reviews.Author: spue

Reviews.Content: A big disappointment! The Albergotto Hotel was the first stop on our Italian holiday which was in celebration of our 30th wedding anniversary. We made our booking directly with the hotel and told them of our happy occasion. Upon our arrival we were given an upgrade and a complimentary bottle of wine. These gestures were nice but did not compensate for the lack of air conditioning which they list as one of their amenities. We expressed our concerns while checking in and were informed by a member of their desk staff that they simply haven't turned on the air conditioning yet. We asked about mosquitos and were told definitively that that would NOT be a problem. Needless to say, by the end of our three night stay, we were covered with mosquito bites. The open window also prevented us from getting any sleep because the vehicular and pedestrian noise never ceased throughout all three nights. A few hours before our departure, we were given a plug-in bug repellent and an aerosol bug spray for the room. When we voiced our complaints, the morning desk clerk acted unsimpathetic and indifferent to our displeasure at staying in a hot, noisy and mosquito infested room. She handed us hotel stationary and a pen and told us to write a letter to the manager about our complaints. We composed a 2 page letter and upon check out (one hour later) were given a 40 percent reduction for our last night's stay. A mere pittance for our pain and suffering. Coincidentally, the air conditioning was turned on just as we were preparing to leave. This was our 4th visit to Florence. The three previous visits were at a hotel a block away on the same street. The Hotel De La Ville treated us like royalty and is where we will definitely return on our next visit to Florence. Aside from the influx of mosquitos, no air conditioning, a broken lift, faded bedspread, the complimentary buffet breakfast was sparce and forgetable. The first three nights of our 30th wedding anniversay at the Albergotto Hotel were a major disappointment!
Reviews.Author: RonCat

Reviews.Content: A great stay We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The front desk staff was incredible and made us feel very welcome. There is some street noise, but not enough to bother us. The hotel is surrounded by upscale shopping, great restaurants, GELATO, everything Florence has to offer. We would absolutely recommend this hotel!
Reviews.Author: Beargonefishin

Reviews.Content: Great Find in Florence I relied on TripAdvisor for this booking, so I thought I would write a review.This was a fantastic hotel. The location is perfect - right in the heart of Florence, close to all of the sights (Duomo, Ponte Vecchio, San Lorenzo Mkt, Santa Maria Novella) and the train/bus station, in the pedestrian part of town, so there are fewer cars, buses and motorbikes. The room was very clean, good sized with beautiful high ceilings and windows. Well furnished with a bed, a small 2-person sitting area, desk, and closet. TV and electric teapot with tea/coffee. The beds were a bit hard, but comfy with nice cotton sheets. Faded floral beadspread and curtains. The bathroom was good-sized with a tub and shower (hand shower). Thick, fluffy white towels hung on a towel heater. Tile and fixtures seemed new. The English-speaking staff were very helpful and friendly. Helped us to get tickets to the museum when we had no reservation. Check in/check out was very easy.Breakfast (included in the room rate) was very good - juices, several kinds of pastries and rolls, whole fruit, cereal, hardboiled eggs, ham and cheese. A waiter brought coffee, tea, hot chocolate, cappucino, etc - whatever you wanted. There were several newspapers in the sitting room in the morning. Other reviewers have mentioned the stairs to the first floor, and this would be a problem with travelers with mobility issues. The porter helped us with our bags, but there is really no other way to get to the 1st floor besides a pretty long climb. Also, we were very glad we booked ahead with an online booking agency. The posted room rate was very high (335 Euros) - we paid much less than this. All in all, I highly recommend the Hotel Albergotto. Comfortable, clean, convenient, safe and charming.
Reviews.Author: bluegreenocean

Reviews.Content: good but no sleep We have just returned from a break in Italy and booked The Albergotto Hotel in Florence. Though the hotel and its location was good and the staff helpful we suffered 3 nights of broken sleep. The traffic noise was appalling and once that eased off the drunken revellers prevented sleep until the traffic started up again. We realise that the location was a city centre but the sound proofing needs improvement.
Reviews.Author: bobreading

Reviews.Content: A Hidden Treasure We had a lovely stay and the location couldn't have been better - but the best part was a huge bathroom with a long tub. The steps are not for the faint of heart but it was a lovely room with a tea pot in the room with a nice selection of tea for an afternoon respite and close to our favorite restaurant Nella.
Reviews.Author: AngelusInc

Reviews.Content: Great location, rooms, and service An excellent location in the shopping area with easy walking access to tourist spots. Large, well maintained, and quiet room. Pleasant and helpful staff. Only downside is that one has to walk up a flight of stairs to reach the elevator to the hotel. The first floor is the Guccin store. However the bellman can be reached by buzzer to help with the luggage.
Reviews.Author: cherry35

Reviews.Content: Perfect for a Florentine break I've never posted a review on anything ever, but I used TripAdvisor extensively before booking my recent holiday and felt obliged to report back! I was anxious to find a hotel in Florence which would be very clean, not soulless, in a good location, with helpful staff and not extortionately expensive - and in this respect the Albergotto completely fit the bill. I had lived in Florence for a month last year so I did know the city and was delighted to find the Albergotto on one of my favourite streets. Via Tornabuoni is lovely as it comes off the Santa Trinita bridge, has some great designer shops to look at as you walk along and is really close to the centre and Oltrano. We booked through LastMinute.com and used the 'secret hotels' function (although I worked out that it was the Albergotto) so because it was cheaper I think our room was one of the smaller standard doubles, but it was very pleasant - extremely clean, with a nice en-suite and a bright airy bedroom. If we poked our heads out of the window we could just about see the Arno too - which is about as perfect as you can get! The staff were really helpful and friendly - very approachable without being intrusive. We didn't really require anything of them but it was nice to know that we could go and ask them things without worrying that they would be grumpy, inexperienced or hard to understand.While we were there it was hot in Florence (which was such a treat given the miserable summer in Britain!!) but the air-con worked fine and our room was a good temperature. On arrival we found a letter in the bedroom, along with some wine, apologising that there had been some problems with the satellite channels and they were trying to fix it. We turned on the tv once a day later and the channels were still all Italian but to be honest who is really going to be watching a lot of tv while staying in Florence?! (you can get english newspapers easily enough if you are desperate for a news fix)I really would not hesitate to recommend this hotel and if I am lucky enough to get back to Florence for another a mini-break I will definitely go there again.(the only thing some people might need to bear in mind - as mentioned in other reviews - is that there are some steps to get up to the reception/ lift. However the porter is extremely helpful and you can buzz up as soon as you arrive for someone to help with the luggage if necessary).
Reviews.Author: FlorenceFan

Reviews.Content: We love this hotel We found this hotel back in 2001 and have stayed there 5 or 6 times since then. As the other reviewers say, this place is a gem... it is a real find in a town with a lot of overpriced hotels. The location is unbeatable, the rooms are impeccably clean and nicely renovated (still looking new!) and the staff are great. We have always loved staying here and feel no need to even look for other choices in Florence anymore.
Reviews.Author: emsavino

Reviews.Content: Fantastic!! We stayed at the Albergotto for 4 nights last month. The hotel was fantastic and the service was wonderful. It is right in the middle of Florence so an excellent location - other reviewers have mentioned a little noise but it wasn't anything we had a problem with (although if we had, it would have been fine as the location is so central). The hotel room was great - really bright and airy with a big bathroom. Breakfast was also lovely - a selection of fruit, danish, rolls, cheese, ham, juices etc - just a case of helping yourself!The staff were lovely and courteous and helped out with a number of things - helping us with our bags, finding and booking a tour for us to the Uffizzi (definitely recommended), booking taxis, recommending restaurants and even upgrading our room as it was my husbands birthday whilst we were there.We will definitely go back to Florence and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again - only problem is that I have told so many people about it that we might have trouble finding a room!
Reviews.Author: alfie10

Reviews.Content: Great Hotel for the Price! We booked this hotel based on Tripadvisor reviews and we were extremely happy with it! We stayed for two nights from April 24 through April 26. Although the hotel is extremely close to the train station, we took a taxi when we arrived because we were tired and did not want to wander the streets with our bags in case we got lost. The trip from the station is short and was under ten euros with two bags. The Good: LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION!!! It was in the middle of the historical area on the bests hopping street in Florence (Gucci is right next door!). The hotel is within minutes of all the major sites! Although it was close to the main train station, which is known for having 鈥渓ess desirable characters鈥?at night, you did not see any of this by the Albergotto Hotel. The room and bathroom were both quite spacious by European standards. Although the d茅cor is simple, the room was clean and comfortable. The breakfast in the morning is typical European fare 鈥?juice, breads, prosciutto  salami, fruits, cereal 鈥?and was quite good. The staff was friendly and helpful. The Not so Good: I really do not have anything negative to say about the hotel, except that you have to walk up a flight of stairs to reach reception and elevator. It may not be convenient for certain people. Also, as mentioned above, the room d茅cor is extremely simple and non-fussy. It is equipped with an older and smaller TV, which may be important to some. Overall, I highly recommend this hotel!
Reviews.Author: v102377

Reviews.Content: what a gem My husband and I stayed at the Albergotto for 3 nights in the middle of a whirlwind tour through four European cities. The place is really a find -- gracious, well-appointed, with an unbeatable location and the nicest, most helpful staff we have encountered anywhere on our travels. We had booked a lower-end room but were upgraded, at no extra charge, when the receptionist found she had a nicer room sitting empty. Our room was huge and bright, but well climate-controlled (a must in Florence in the summer). We have booked another stay at the Albergotto this summer and would not stay anywhere else in Florence.
Reviews.Author: calif_girl01

Reviews.Content: Buy me, buy me now! Absolutely first rate hotel for the price- we booked through lastminute.com. A fantastic location for fashionistas- right next door to Dior, Gucci and YSL just nano seconds along the block. What I saved on the hotel price, I spent in these shops! Lovely spacious room and very well appointed bathroom. Overlooks busy street so can be a bit noisy, but didn't unduly bother us. Hotel staff very helpful- arranged a tour of Designer outlet sites for us- Prada, Gucci, Armani etc. Good food, both choice and quality at breakfast, but no restaurant. Walking distance of all sights.One very irritating point- we were there in October, and it was unseasonably cold, but the hotel was unheated and our request for the heating to be switched on was met withe seemingly bizarre statement that it had to be switched on by the Mayor! Apparently it was on some communal city system, and switched on at the beginning of November!! We left the hair dryer on maximum all night.
Reviews.Author: sisgb

Reviews.Content: Great place to stay in Florence The Albergotto was a wonderful place to stay. The staff was professional and personable and very patient. The room was great, as were amenities and location. It's within walking distance to everything. Rates were good. I would highly recommend it as THE place to stay in Florence.
Reviews.Author: kbgnorth

Reviews.Content: Charming hotel, terrific location What a charming hotel! The location cannot be beat! My husband and I (and our study-abroad daughter) stayed for 3 nights in Oct., 2006. We were charmed by the entrance (yes, it does require a walk-up of 1 flight of stairs until one reaches the elevator), but...it provides a feel for Italian apartments. Our room was overlooking the street (it was one of the rooms for 3 people), we loved opening the windows and seeing the charm of Florence!. The staff were extremely helpful and always pleasant. The breakfast was more than adequate...always a stock of fresh fruit, juices, cereal, yogurts.hard-boiled eggs,cheeses and bread....and given how we ate our way through Italy, we looked forward to beginning our day with some healthy choices.The large bathroom was more than adequate! We would definitely stay there again and highly recommend.
Reviews.Author: dbfm1

Reviews.Content: Great Location and Staff All the staff were superb and very helpfull,rooms were good and the central location is fantastic to see all the sights of Florence.The great location however means that the streets outside the hotel are quite lively at night, so if the noise bothers you take some earplugs and enjoy all that this cracking hotel has to offer.Would definately stay again.
Reviews.Author: LeePayne

Reviews.Content: We loved the Hotel Albergotto! My husband and I just returned from our honeymoon, and spent our last five days in Florence at the Hotel Albergotto. After having spent two weeks on a cruise ship, a few days in Venice, and a few more in Siena, we were very excited to be in Florence. The hotel was wonderful. We did have one of those front rooms, but the noise didn't seem too bad to us. We realize that we were in big city on a main road, so the type of typical traffic sounds are to be expected. On the third floor, you don't hear the walking traffic too much.The room itself was lovely, with high ceilings, and large floor to ceiling doors that open to Via Tournabuoni. The closet has more than enough space to accommodate a two-person wardrobe, there is a mini-bar so it is possible to refrigerate items, and of course, a safe.What I loved, however, were the bathrooms. In our Venice and Siena hotels, the bathrooms were small-ish, and the showers were tiny. When we saw our bathroom at the Albergotto, I was so excited because it was large, and has an actual bathtub to soak in. There is a lot of natural light through the frosted door, which for the ladies out there certainly helps with makeup application. :)The service staff was very friendly, especially with carrying all of our bags up the entry stairs. Our room was always cleaned by noon (even if we were only gone for an hour in the morning), and every day except one the beds were turned down.The breakfast wasn't anything to write home about, but the staff was very quick to ask for our coffee requests. I did enjoy their croissants and corn flakes. :)What I did love about the hotel was the accessibility of the reception staff prior to our stay. They booked all of our tours and sights, made wonderful dining and shopping recommendations while we were there, and saw to it that we were comfortable.We hope to return to Florence one day, and will definitely stay at the Hotel Albergotto.
Reviews.Author: pilawpina

Reviews.Content: Super hotel, top notch customer service My husband and I stayed at the Albergotto for one night last week at the height of tourist season in Florence, and we were thrilled. Great location, spacious and clean room, nice breakfast and daily papers from around the world. VERY helpful bellman and front desk woman who organized the car parking service for us and lugged our bags up the steps. Good value for money. If you are looking for a quality, centrally located hotel for a reasonable price, this is the place for you.
Reviews.Author: boondoggle

Reviews.Content: A great central hotel We stayed for 2 nights in this hotel as part of our honeymoon. On arrival the porter took our luggage to our room and then returned with a bottle of sparkling wine in honour of our honeymoon - a lovely touch.The hotel is in a fantastic central location and is near to all of the designer shops. The room was large, nicely furnished and very quiet.Breakfast was really good, there was a wide selection of various continental breaksfast items and there was plenty of it!The hotel staff speak great english and they are very knowledgable about the city. We asked for a restaurant recommendation on our first night and we were directed to a lovely authentic place that was not overly priced - we had a great meal.We will definately return to this hotel again on a return visit to Florence.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: WARNING The Albergotto hotel in Florence needs it's stars reviewed. It has a 4 star rating and they must of stolen three of them. The hotel is in a PERFECT location for any vistor to the city. It is centrally located within walking distance to all the tourist points. The problem is the hotel itself. The reception of the hotel is on the first floor which is accessable by a couple of flights of stairs or a tiny elevator. Once checked in, you can take the stairs which are easier. The tiny elevator will always stop on the first floor which is very inconvenient and confusing if you are staying on the 2nd or 3rd floors. Also after a long day of walking around Florence, walking to the elevator is a real drag. The rooms are standard, nothing special and need work. My room at the front of the hotel, I might have well been sleeping in the square because the noise is incredible. The street leadiing into the square pulls the noise from the square plus the cafe next door is a busy drinking bar till late into the evening. Don't plan on quiet until about 2am. The rooms in the back of the hotel are better but the light is not as good and are in high in demand because of the noisy front rooms. The shower in one of the rooms had no temperature control once on, so midway through my shower I would be either scalded with extremely hot water or shocked with extrememly cold water. Very dangerous in the slippery tub. Also one of shower panels were missing so I would flood the bath room each time I took a shower. The hotel's breakfast is below average compared to other hotels that I have stayed at in Florence and especially for the room rate I paid. The breakfast is your standard bread and coffee breakfast with a small selection of fruit, ham and boiled eggs. If you are a big marmalade fan, half the breakfast table offering is trays of jams and marmalade. They advertise the breakfast starting from 7:30am to 10am, but they don't really get it together until about 8am. This is very inconvenient if you are on business and need to get an earlier start. I found the front desk staff to have major attitude and very unhelpful and rude. I inquired about the internet rate at the hotel and the night clerk had no idea what the rate they charged although I did manage to get the user name and password for the room. I inquired about another hotel number from the desk and the attitude I got was I asked for the number of a hotel on the moon. Another inquiry for how to dial a long distance call, I never got the answer, even after I came down from my room and was face to face with them. The service staff on the other hand was very good and helpful. The porter was very helpful and accomadating when needed. The wait staff in the breakfast room was always pleasant even if they didn't have it together on time. I have stayed at many Florence hotels and was taken aback by the qualtiy of the rooms and the front desk staff attitude for the rate they were charging compared to other Florentine hotels. The only benefit of this hotel is the location but you can also find a ton of hotels in the area for better prices and ammenitites. This is definatley a dud of a hotel and I think the management need to stay in their own hotel to understand what needs to be fixed. There are better quality and better priced hotels. The Albergotto hotel thinks it is better that it is. The need to get out and look at the competiton and maybe stay in one of their rooms to understand what their guest feel like.
Reviews.Author: fashionfirst

Reviews.Content: Central location, super room I had booked two nights at the Antica Torre up the street (via Tornabuoni). When I arrived however they sent me up to this hotel for one night as Antica Torre had had a problem with their AC in my room the day I arrived. Initially I was unhappy as I was really looking forward to my terraced room at the A. T. However once I arrived I was charmed. The room was quite large with light-colored hardwood floors. (I am a sucker for hardwood). The bathroom was also fairly spacious, especially by European hotel standards, and was all tile. There was a large armoire in the room as well as a beautiful secretary type desk (the kind that folds open and closed). There were also a few chairs in the room. As you can see it was very spacious as there was ample room for these items with much room to spare. I'd say the room was at least 16x16 or maybe even larger. The large windows (which opened, typical European style) made the room very bright and airy. Adding to the room size was a sort of foyer when you first walked in to it, to your left was the bathroom and as you walked into the room itself you were then in the space described above. This was room 32. There was no real view other than to the street below, which was fine. You definitely did not feel cramped. I paid 230E for that night. My other night was at the AT as mentioned above and to be honest it was nearly a draw as to which I preferred. The terrace at the Antica Torre definitely edged it out, but, overall I much preferred my room at the Albergotto. Were it wintertime or just rainy/bad weather in general I would have stayed at the Albergotto instead as you wouldn't then have full enjoyment of the terrace at the AT.
Reviews.Author: skywalkerbeth

Reviews.Content: Great Hotel in a Great Location and not super expensive! This hotel was great. We've stayed a couple of times now and we have never been dissappointed. The inclusive breakfast is more than plenty, the staff is knowledgeable and helpful,the rooms are very clean and above all you can't beat the location. Just next to Gucci, Prada, Roberto Cavalli, within a couple of blocks to the main Piazza. The rooms are decent sized especially for Italy. We paid $150 per night during August and about $99 during March. We will keep going back to this place. The only downside is you have to walk up from the street to the first floor and catch the small elevator. Not handicap or stroller friendly. The place is very secure though.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: the best chrismas decoration in florence What a charming hotel ! The entrance had an absolutely superb christmas decoration! Great staff, very cosy, perfect location for shopping during the holiday season.A great find ! I will definately want to go back to albergotto.
